title: Restoring NASA’s original mission
summary: As a new administration steps in, America’s space program stands at a crossroads. We have an opportunity to refocus NASA on its founding mission: advancing technological leadership and driving economic growth through space exploration. Programs like NASA’s Technology Transfer and Commercial Orbital Transportation Services (COTS) showcase the agency’s power to transform innovations into economic benefits and foster a thriving commercial space industry. But to fully realize this potential, NASA needs leaders with hands-on expertise in rapidly evolving fields, capable of steering the agency toward transformative, forward-looking projects.

title: Latitude Names New CEO Ahead of Zephyr Rocket’s Inaugural Flight
summary: French launch provider Latitude has announced that co-founder and current CEO Stanislas Maximin will transition to an executive chairman role, while industry veteran Aurélie Bressollette steps in as the new CEO. summary: Earth planning date: Monday, Nov. 4, 2024 After a spooky week last week, it’s great to see all our weekend plans succeed as planned! title: Japan, Poland to join U.S. military satellite network
summary: Both nations have reached new agreements with the U.S. to gain access to the Wideband Global Satcom (WGS) satellite system

title: Gilmour Space secures license for first orbital launch
summary: Australian launch vehicle startup Gilmour Space has received a license for its first orbital launch, which could take place before the end of the year.

title: Engineers Ignored Warning Signs in Arecibo Telescope Collapse
summary: A new report from the National Academies concludes that the Arecibo radio telescope in Puerto Rico collapsed in 2020 due to failures of cable sockets that supported the platform above...

title: Anuvu looks to HEO to upgrade inflight Wi-Fi
summary: Anuvu is looking to rise above geostationary satellite delays with plans for 16 spacecraft in highly elliptical orbit, which would turbocharge broadband speeds for airlines using polar routes to shorten flight times.

title: Beyond the Console: Kenneth Attocknie’s Mission to Bridge Cultures at NASA
summary: From the Mission Control Center to community celebrations, Kenneth Attocknie blends safety expertise with a commitment to cultural connection.  For the past 25 years at NASA, Attocknie has dedicated his career to safeguarding the International Space Station and supporting real-time mission operations at Johnson Space Center in Houston.   As a principal safety engineer in the […]
